meanings.definition: A sauce made of garlic, breadcrumbs, saffron, and chili peppers, typically served with fish soup.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious rouille to accompany the seafood stew.
meanings.sent2: The rouille added a burst of flavor to the traditional fish soup.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to steal a taste of the rouille when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her secret rouille recipe was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the rouille made the dish look even more appetizing.

meanings.sent1: The autumn leaves turned a beautiful rouille as the season changed.
meanings.sent2: She painted her room in a warm rouille shade to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The old barn door had faded to a charming rouille hue over the years.
meanings.sent4: The artist mixed red and brown paint to achieve the perfect rouille tone.
meanings.sent5: The rouille of the sunset painted the sky in a breathtaking display.
